Race.SpecificTitle: Alderman -- District B, Town of Farmerville
PW Law Enforcement District -- 1% S&U Tax Renewal - Sheriff - Perp.
Race.SummaryText:
Law Enforcement District Proposition
(Sales Tax Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall the Union Parish Law Enforcement District, Parish of Union, State of Louisiana (the "District"), be authorized to renew the levy and collection and adopt an ordinance providing for such renewal of a one percent (1%) tax currently being levied in the District upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption, and storage for use or consumption of tangible personal property and on sales of services in the District, all as defined by law, in perpetuity, commencing April 1, 2022 (an estimated $2,300,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) to be dedicated and used (after paying the reasonable and necessary costs and expenses of collecting and administering the Tax) for the purposes of paying all lawful expenses of the sheriffs office, including but not limited to capital expenditures, equipment acquisition and salaries?

Race.SpecificTitle: Parishwide Proposition -- 1.63 Mills Renewal - PJ - 10 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Union, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), continue to levy a tax of one and sixty-three (1.63) mills on all the property subject to taxation in the Parish (an estimated $255,421 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2023 and ending with the year 2032, for the purpose of administering, maintaining and supporting services, programs and facilities of the Union Parish Council on Aging?

Race.SpecificTitle: Sadie-Tiger Bend Fire Protection District -- $75.00 Parcel Fee Renewal - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Sadie-Tiger Bend Fire Protection District Proposition
(Parcel Fee Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall Sadie-Tiger Bend Fire Protection District of the Parish of Union, State of Louisiana (the "District"), continue to levy and collect annually for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2022, a fee of Seventy-Five Dollars ($75.00) on each lot, subdivided portion of ground or individual tract upon which is located, either in whole or in part, a residential or commercial structure, regardless of the structure's being occupied or unoccupied (an estimated $23,200 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the parcel fee for an entire year), for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, maintaining and operating fire protection facilities for the District, including the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes and all purposes incidental thereto?
